interface.name: SnmpAccessControlModel
interface.javadoc:
Access Control Model interface. Every access control model must implement this interface in order to be integrated in the engine based framework.

This API is a Sun Microsystems internal API and is subject to change without notice.

1.5

Method called by the dispatcher in order to control the access at an SnmpOid Level. If access is not allowed, an SnmpStatusException is thrown. This method is called after the checkPduAccess pdu based method. version The SNMP protocol version number. principal The request principal. securityLevel The request security level as defined in SnmpEngine. pduType The pdu type (get, set, ...). securityModel The security model ID. contextName The access control context name. oid The OID to check.

Method called by the dispatcher in order to control the access at an SNMP pdu Level. If access is not allowed, an SnmpStatusException is thrown. In case of exception, the access control is aborted. OIDs are not checked. This method should be called prior to the checkAccess OID based method. version The SNMP protocol version number. principal The request principal. securityLevel The request security level as defined in SnmpEngine. pduType The pdu type (get, set, ...). securityModel The security model ID. contextName The access control context name. pdu The pdu to check.

Enable SNMP V1 and V2 set requests. Be aware that can lead to a security hole in a context of SNMP V3 management. By default SNMP V1 and V2 set requests are not authorized.
boolean True the activation suceeded.

Disable SNMP V1 and V2 set requests. By default SNMP V1 and V2 set requests are not authorized.
boolean True the deactivation suceeded.

The SNMP V1 and V2 set requests authorization status. By default SNMP V1 and V2 set requests are not authorized.
boolean True SNMP V1 and V2 requests are authorized.
